Package frc.team_8840_lib.controllers

Class SwerveGroup

java.lang.Object
frc.team_8840_lib.utils.IO.IOLayer
frc.team_8840_lib.replay.Replayable
frc.team_8840_lib.controllers.SwerveGroup
All Implemented Interfaces:
Loggable
public class SwerveGroup extends Replayable
Your standard swerve drive class. Based on the wonderful work of Team 364. Repo Here Uses CANCoders, Pigeon, and Talons/NEOs for the swerve modules.

  • Constructor Details

    • SwerveGroup

      public SwerveGroup(String name, SwerveSettings settings, int[] driveIDs, int[] steerIDs, int[] encoderIDs, Pigeon pigeon)
      Creates a new swerve group (4 modules)
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the swerve group
      settings - Settings for the swerve group
      driveIDs - Drive motor IDs
      steerIDs - Steering/turning motor IDs
      encoderIDs - Encoder IDs
      pigeon - Gyroscope (Pigeon 2.0 or IMU, use Pigeon class)

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()

    • getModName

      public static String getModName(int i)

    • ready

      public boolean ready()

    • setSpeed

      public void setSpeed(double value)
      Sets the speed of every module. Uses open loop.
      Parameters:
      value - Speeds for each module

    • setState

      @Deprecated public void setState(edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.SwerveModuleState state, boolean openLoop)
      Deprecated.
      Use setModuleStates(SwerveModuleState[]) instead. This is deprecated since it's dangerous to use, and it's not used anywhere in the code. Only use this method for testing.
      Sets the state of every module using one state. Uses closed or open loop.
      Parameters:
      state - State for each module.

    • setState

      @Deprecated public void setState(edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.SwerveModuleState state)
      Deprecated.
      Use setModuleStates(SwerveModuleState[]) instead. This is deprecated since it's dangerous to use, and it's not used anywhere in the code. Only use this method for testing.
      Sets the state of every module using an array of states. Uses open loop.

    • drive

      public void drive(edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Translation2d translation, double rotation, boolean fieldRelative, boolean openLoop)
      Sets the speed and rotation of each module using a translation and rotation.
      Parameters:
      translation - Translation for the robot
      rotation - Rotation of the robot, in radians.
      fieldRelative - Whether the translation is field relative or not
      openLoop - Whether to use open loop or closed loop

    • driveStates

      public edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.SwerveModuleState[] driveStates(edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Translation2d translation2d, double rotation, boolean fieldRelative, boolean applyDesaturation)
      Return SwerveModuleStates for drive
      Parameters:
      translation2d - Translation for the robot
      rotation - Rotation of the robot, in radians.
      fieldRelative - Whether the translation is field relative or not

    • setModuleStates

      public void setModuleStates(edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.SwerveModuleState[] states, boolean isOpenLoop)
      Sets the module states of the robot using a list of states. It's recommended to use drive(Translation2d, double, boolean, boolean) instead of this directly since this can be dangerous to use for things other than testing.
      Parameters:
      states - States for each module The order of the states is as follows: Front Left, Front Right, Back Left, Back Right
      isOpenLoop - Whether to use open loop or closed loop

    • setModuleStates

      public void setModuleStates(edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.SwerveModuleState[] states, boolean isOpenLoop, boolean ignoreAngleLimit)
      Sets the module states of the robot using a list of states. It's recommended to use drive(Translation2d, double, boolean, boolean) instead of this directly since this can be dangerous to use for things other than testing.
      Parameters:
      states - States for each module The order of the states is as follows: Front Left, Front Right, Back Left, Back Right
      isOpenLoop - Whether to use open loop or closed loop
      ignoreAngleLimit - Whether to ignore the angle limit or not

    • spin

      public void spin(double radiansPerSecond)
      Rotates the robot in place.
      Parameters:
      radiansPerSecond - The speed at which the robot should rotate, in radians per second.

    • resetToAbsolute

      public void resetToAbsolute()

    • applyXBrake

      public void applyXBrake()
      Sets the module rotations to form an "x" with the directions of the wheels. This is especially useful when the robot is stopped since it can prevent other robots from pushing it.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Sets all module speeds to 0

    • setBrakeModes

      public void setBrakeModes(boolean brake)
      Sets the brake modes of all the modules
      Parameters:
      brake - Whether to brake (true) or coast (false)

    • setIndividualBrakeModes

      public void setIndividualBrakeModes(boolean driveBrake, boolean steerBrake)
      Set the drive brake and steer brake modes of all the modules
      Parameters:
      driveBrake - Whether to brake (true) the drive motors
      steerBrake - Whether to brake (true) the steer motors

    • setAllModuleAngles

      public void setAllModuleAngles(double degree)
      Sets the angle of all the modules to a certain degree
      Parameters:
      degree - The degree to set the modules to

    • setModuleStates

      public void setModuleStates(edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.SwerveModuleState[] states)
      Sets the module states of the robot using a list of states, and makes it automatically use closed loop. It's recommended to use drive(Translation2d, double, boolean, boolean) instead of this directly since this can be dangerous to use for things other than testing.
      Parameters:
      states - States for each module

    • getModuleStates

      public edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.SwerveModuleState[] getModuleStates()
      Gets the modules states of the swerve drive
      Returns:
      The states of the modules

    • loop

      public void loop(SwerveLoop s_loop)
      Uses a lambda to loop through each module. This can be used for information gathering, setting variables, and more.
      Parameters:
      s_loop - The lambda to use. Takes in the module and the index of the module.

    • resetOdometry

      public void resetOdometry(edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose2d pose)
      Resets the odometry of the robot to the provided pose.
      Parameters:
      pose - The pose to reset the odometry to
